sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词的均含"设计，设想"之意。
means: devise ： 侧重设计的临时性和权宜性，并隐含有更多的设想可用。
conceive ： 强调在制定计划之前的先有设想构思。
formulate与conceive相反，指在devise之后的具体设计活动。

sentence.Network_en: Experts are trying to devise ways to clean up the huge slick.
sentence.Network_cn: 专家们正想方设法清除这片面积巨大的浮油。

sentence.Network_en: White supremacists devise new Methods: To disenfranchise Negroes.
sentence.Network_cn: 白人至上论者想出新的方法以剥夺黑人的公民权.

sentence.Network_en: It is not easy to devise means.

the spring safety system has been overload devised , allowing body such as iron pieces through the crushing chamber without jeopardizing machines .其弹簧保险系统是过载保护装置，可使异物铁块通过破碎腔而不危害机器，采用干油或水两种密封形式。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: the verb from Old French deviser, from Latin divis- 'divided', from the verb dividere (this sense being reflected in the original English sense of the verb); the noun is a variant of device (in the early sense 'will, desire')

entry.def: If you devise a plan, system, or machine, you have the idea for it and design it.

example.ex: We devised a scheme to help him...
example.tran: 我们想出了一个帮他的计策。

example.ex: New long-range objectives must be devised.
example.tran: 必须规划出新的长期目标。

means.word_mean: 1. a will disposing of real property
2. (law) a gift of real property by will
1. come up with (an idea, plan, explanation, theory, or priciple) after a mental effort;

sentences.sentence: "excogitate a way to measure the speed of light"

means.word_mean: 2. arrange by systematic planning and united effort;

sentences.sentence: "devise a plan to take over the director's office"

means.word_mean: 3. give by will, especially real property

auth_sentence.content: The system he helped devise became known as Siteswap.
auth_sentence.res_content: The system he helped devise became known as Siteswap.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The system he helped devise became known as Siteswap.

auth_sentence.content: She could devise some means to persuade him.
auth_sentence.res_content: She could devise some means to persuade him.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She could devise some means to persuade him.

auth_sentence.content: Each individual must devise his own ethical code.
auth_sentence.res_content: Each individual must devise his own ethical code.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each individual must devise his own ethical code.

stems_affixes.word_buile: di分开+vis分开+ible能……的→adj.可分的
advise建议+able能……的→adj.可取的, 明智的
advise[v.忠告,劝告,建议;通知,告知]+ory……的→adj.劝告的
provision预备+al……的→预备的,临时的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 看得见的, 明显的, 显著的
stems_affixes.word_buile: vis看,查+ible能……的→adj.看得见的, 明显的, 显著的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有远见的,有洞察力的;空想的
stems_affixes.word_buile: vision[n.视力,视觉;远见;洞察力;幻想,幻影;想象力]+ary……的→adj.有远见的,有洞察力的;空想的
vis看,查+ual……的→adj.看的,看得见的;视觉的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 装置, 设计, 图案, 策略, 发明物, 设备
stems_affixes.word_buile: de分开+vice=vis分开→分离出→想出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 分,分割;部门,科,处;除法;分界线
stems_affixes.word_buile: di分开+vis分开+ion表名词→n.分,分割;部门,科,处;除法;分界线
advise[v.忠告,劝告,建议;通知,告知]→ n.忠告,建议;告知
advise建议+or人→advisor顾问

stems_affixes.value_cn: 供应,[一批]供应品;预备;条款;[
stems_affixes.word_buile: pro前,提前+vis看,查+ion表名词→供应;预备
revise[v.修订,校订;修正,修改]+ion表名词→n.修改,修订

stems_affixes.value_cn: 监考人,管理人,检查员,主管人,[计]超级用户
stems_affixes.word_buile: supervise[v.临视]+or人等→n.监考人,管理人,检查员,主管人,[计]超级用户
vis看,查+a→看过了的,查过了的→允许入境

stems_affixes.value_cn: 视力,视觉;远见;洞察力;幻想,幻影;想象力
stems_affixes.word_buile: vis看,查+ion表名词→n.视力,视觉;远见;洞察力;幻想,幻影;想象力

stems_affixes.value_cn: 访问者, 来宾, 游客
stems_affixes.word_buile: visit[n.&v.拜访, 访问, 游览, 参观]+or人→n.访问者, 来宾, 游客

stems_affixes.value_cn: 拜访, 访问, 游览, 参观
stems_affixes.word_buile: vis看,查+it走→边走边看→游览

stems_affixes.value_cn: 设计;发明;图谋;作出[计划];想出[办法]
stems_affixes.word_buile: de分开+vis分开+e→分离出→想出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 忠告,劝告,建议;通知,告知
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad=according+vis看,查+e→根据查看而提出
pre预先+vis看,查+e→v.预知,预先警告
re再+vis看,查+e→再看→修正
vis看,查+a→看过了的,查过了的→允许入境
visual[adj.看的,看得见的;视觉的]+ize表动词→v.想象
super在上面+vis看+e→在上面看→临视

Sentence.sentence: Governments in developed nations devise and implement policy that changes consumer expectations.
In devising a way to assess hope scientifically, Doctor Snyder went beyond the simple notion that hope is merely the sense that everything will turn out all right.
Snyder, a psychologist, who has devised a scale to assess how much hope a person has.

means.word_mean: 想出; 计划; 设计; 发明

sentences.en: He has devised a scheme for making money.
sentences.cn: 他想出一个赚钱的办法。

sentences.en: He is devising how to do that thing.
sentences.cn: 他正计划如何进行那件事情。

jushi.english: He devised an instrument to measure light waves.
jushi.chinese: 他发明了一种测量光波的仪器。

jushi.english: That scholar has devised a new method of teaching foreign languages.
jushi.chinese: 那位学者发明了一种教外语的新方法。
